name: CategoryTheory.ProjectiveResolution.mk.sizeOf_spec
initialProofState:
C : Type u
inst‚úù¬≥ : CategoryTheory.Category.{v, u} C
inst‚úù¬≤ : CategoryTheory.Limits.HasZeroObject C
inst‚úù¬π : CategoryTheory.Limits.HasZeroMorphisms C
Z : C
inst‚úù : SizeOf C
complex : ChainComplex C Nat
projective : autoParam (‚àÄ (n : Nat), CategoryTheory.Projective (complex.X n)) _auto‚úù
hasHomology : ‚àÄ (i : Nat), HomologicalComplex.HasHomology complex i
œÄ : Quiver.Hom complex ((ChainComplex.single‚ÇÄ C).obj Z)
quasiIso : autoParam (QuasiIso œÄ) _auto‚úù
‚ä¢ Eq (SizeOf.sizeOf (CategoryTheory.ProjectiveResolution.mk complex projective œÄ quasiIso)) (HAdd.hAdd (HAdd.hAdd (HAdd.hAdd 1 (SizeOf.sizeOf complex)) (SizeOf.sizeOf œÄ)) (SizeOf.sizeOf quasiIso))
decl:
/--
A `ProjectiveResolution Z` consists of a bundled `‚Ñï`-indexed chain complex of projective objects,
along with a quasi-isomorphism to the complex consisting of just `Z` supported in degree `0`.
-/
structure ProjectiveResolution (Z : C) where
  /-- the chain complex involved in the resolution -/
  complex : ChainComplex C ‚Ñï
  /-- the chain complex must be degreewise projective -/
  projective : ‚àÄ n, Projective (complex.X n) := by infer_instance
  /-- the chain complex must have homology -/
  [hasHomology : ‚àÄ i, complex.HasHomology i]
  /-- the morphism to the single chain complex with `Z` in degree `0` -/
  œÄ : complex ‚ü∂ (ChainComplex.single‚ÇÄ C).obj Z
  /-- the morphism to the single chain complex with `Z` in degree `0` is a quasi-isomorphism -/
  quasiIso : QuasiIso œÄ := by infer_instance

name: CategoryTheory.HasProjectiveResolution.out
initialProofState:
C : Type u
inst‚úù¬≤ : CategoryTheory.Category.{v, u} C
inst‚úù¬π : CategoryTheory.Limits.HasZeroObject C
inst‚úù : CategoryTheory.Limits.HasZeroMorphisms C
Z : C
self : CategoryTheory.HasProjectiveResolution Z
‚ä¢ Nonempty (CategoryTheory.ProjectiveResolution Z)
decl:
/-- An object admits a projective resolution.
-/
class HasProjectiveResolution (Z : C) : Prop where
  out : Nonempty (ProjectiveResolution Z)

name: CategoryTheory.HasProjectiveResolutions.out
initialProofState:
C : Type u
inst‚úù¬≤ : CategoryTheory.Category.{v, u} C
inst‚úù¬π : CategoryTheory.Limits.HasZeroObject C
inst‚úù : CategoryTheory.Limits.HasZeroMorphisms C
self : CategoryTheory.HasProjectiveResolutions C
Z : C
‚ä¢ CategoryTheory.HasProjectiveResolution Z
decl:
/-- You will rarely use this typeclass directly: it is implied by the combination
`[EnoughProjectives C]` and `[Abelian C]`.
By itself it's enough to set up the basic theory of derived functors.
-/
class HasProjectiveResolutions : Prop where
  out : ‚àÄ Z : C, HasProjectiveResolution Z

name: CategoryTheory.ProjectiveResolution.complex_exactAt_succ
initialProofState:

‚ä¢ HomologicalComplex.ExactAt P.complex (HAdd.hAdd n 1)
decl:
lemma complex_exactAt_succ (n : ‚Ñï) :
    P.complex.ExactAt (n + 1) := by
  rw [‚Üê quasiIsoAt_iff_exactAt' P.œÄ (n + 1) (exactAt_succ_single_obj _ _)]
  infer_instance

name: CategoryTheory.ProjectiveResolution.exact_succ
initialProofState:
C : Type u
inst‚úù¬≤ : CategoryTheory.Category.{v, u} C
inst‚úù¬π : CategoryTheory.Limits.HasZeroObject C
inst‚úù : CategoryTheory.Limits.HasZeroMorphisms C
Z : C
P : CategoryTheory.ProjectiveResolution Z
n : Nat
‚ä¢ (CategoryTheory.ShortComplex.mk (P.complex.d (HAdd.hAdd n 2) (HAdd.hAdd n 1)) (P.complex.d (HAdd.hAdd n 1) n) ‚ãØ).Exact
decl:
lemma exact_succ (n : ‚Ñï) :
    (ShortComplex.mk _ _ (P.complex.d_comp_d (n + 2) (n + 1) n)).Exact :=
  ((HomologicalComplex.exactAt_iff' _ (n + 2) (n + 1) n) (by simp only [prev]; rfl)
    (by simp)).1 (P.complex_exactAt_succ n)

name: CategoryTheory.ProjectiveResolution.instEpiFNatœÄ

name: CategoryTheory.ProjectiveResolution.self_complex
initialProofState:
C : Type u
inst‚úù¬≥ : CategoryTheory.Category.{v, u} C
inst‚úù¬≤ : CategoryTheory.Limits.HasZeroObject C
inst‚úù¬π : CategoryTheory.Limits.HasZeroMorphisms C
Z : C
inst‚úù : CategoryTheory.Projective Z
‚ä¢ Eq (CategoryTheory.ProjectiveResolution.self Z).complex ((ChainComplex.single‚ÇÄ C).obj Z)
decl:
/-- A projective object admits a trivial projective resolution: itself in degree 0. -/
@[simps]
noncomputable def self [Projective Z] : ProjectiveResolution Z where
  complex := (ChainComplex.single‚ÇÄ C).obj Z
  œÄ := ùüô ((ChainComplex.single‚ÇÄ C).obj Z)
  projective n := by
    cases n
    ¬∑ simpa
    ¬∑ apply IsZero.projective
      apply HomologicalComplex.isZero_single_obj_X
      simp
